intro: Crotalaria florida, commonly known as the Florida crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and disturbed sites. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Crotalaria florida is also known for its potential medicinal properties and has been studied for its use in traditional herbal remedies.
